etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Zoologist: a miscellany of natural history. From retention + -ist

definitions: Generally. A person who advocates the retention of something; a supporter of retention.

A person who advocates the retention of territory, especially the retention by the United States of the Philippines and other Spanish overseas territories annexed during the Spanish-American War (1898).
A person who advocates the retention of a law or practice; specifically a person who advocates the retention of capital (or occasionally corporal) punishment.
Of or relating to retentionists; that advocates retention of something.
